title: The Chase's Shaun Wallace leaves fans in hysterics with his epic E.T impression
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

Get the biggest celebs stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

The Chaser Shaun Wallace has been labelled as "hilarious" on tonight's episode of The Chase.

Shaun Wallace, also known as 'The Dark Destroyer', seemed in a particularly good mood as he revealed his secret talent.

Shaun showed off his Michael Cane, Dalek and ET impression to the live studio audience, the contestants and host Bradley Walsh.

(Image: ITV)

Fans took to Twitter to comment on the Chaser's happy attitude and hilarious impressions which saw him adopt a silly voice.

One wrote: "Think Shaun has been on my sherry!"

While another shared: "Shaun's making me laugh like a good 'un today!"

A third commented: "The best 5 minute introduction of any Chaser on today's Chase. Top work! Top impressions."

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

Viewers revealed they were in hysterics as Shaun pointed to the losing contestant and said in an E.T inspired voice: "In the word of E.T, Elliot go home."

Another viewer pointed out how good Shaun's impression was: "Omg Shaun does sound like a Dalek as well."

Shaun's comical nature on tonight's episode of the popular ITV quiz comes after yesterday's hilarious episode where a wrestling superfan called Chaser Mark Labbett a 'bigger daddy'.

The quiz show hopeful got very flustered as she attempted to woo The Chaser and get in his good books.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

In recent The Chase news, Paul Sinha spoke out about his future on the show if Parkinson's disease impacts his knowledge.

The 49-year-old, nicknamed The Sinnerman, vowed to continue working as a Chaser until he noticed it was affecting his ability to answer questions.
description: Chaser Shaun Wallace has been branded as "hilarious" after he revealed his secret talent of performing impressions
